title: Weekly Progress Report - Week 1
content:
This week, we focused on literature review and project planning. We identified key areas for research: lithium-ion vs lead-acid batteries comparison. Initial research indicates lithium-ion batteries have higher energy density but lead-acid is more cost-effective for certain applications.

Tasks completed:
1. Project timeline established
2. Literature review started
3. Safety procedures documented

Next week: Begin experimental setup and initial testing.

batteryData.notes: Initial measurements on standard lithium-ion cell

reviewerComments: Good progress. Make sure to include more quantitative data in next report.

title: Lead Acid Battery Test Results
content:
Experiment conducted on 12V lead-acid battery:

Procedure:
1. Fully charged battery using standard charger
2. Applied constant 5A load using resistor bank
3. Measured voltage every 15 minutes
4. Recorded until voltage dropped to 10.5V

Results:
- Initial voltage: 12.8V
- Final voltage: 10.5V
- Discharge time: 2 hours 15 minutes
- Calculated capacity: 11.25Ah
- Temperature increase: 8Â°C

Conclusion: Battery performed within expected parameters. Some voltage sag observed under load.

title: Cost Analysis Comparison
content:
Comparative analysis of battery costs:

1. Lithium-ion (18650 cell):
   - Unit cost: $5.50
   - Energy density: 250 Wh/kg
   - Cycle life: 500 cycles
   - Cost per cycle: $0.011

2. Lead-acid (12V 7Ah):
   - Unit cost: $25.00
   - Energy density: 30 Wh/kg
   - Cycle life: 300 cycles
   - Cost per cycle: $0.083

3. Nickel-cadmium (AA size):
   - Unit cost: $3.00
   - Energy density: 60 Wh/kg
   - Cycle life: 1000 cycles
   - Cost per cycle: $0.003

Conclusion: Nickel-cadmium has lowest cost per cycle but environmental concerns exist.

batteryData.notes: Theoretical analysis based on market prices
